bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Motion
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
Comes now Luther Weedin, Commissioner of Immigration, respondent herein, and moves the court for an order adjudging the bond of the petitioner, JUNICHI YAMAMOTO, to be forfeited.
This motion is based upon the records and files herein and upon the affidavit of Luther Weedin, hereto attach- ed
LUTHER WEEDEN, being first duly sworn, on oath de- poses and says: That he is Commissioner of Immigration of the United States at Seattle, Washington, and the respondent herein;

That heretofore and on the 6th day of May, 1922, the above entiteld court entered an order herein denying the petition of petitioner herein for a writ of habeas corpus; that thereafter and on the 11th day of July, 1922, this court entered its further order wherein the said petitioner was directed to forthwith surrender himself into the custody of affiant as Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, to be deported in accordance with a warrant of deportation heretofore issued and executed by the Secretary of Labor of the United States.

That the said petitioner JUNICHI YAMAMOTO has failed, neglected and refused to surrender himself into affiant's custody as directed in said latter order and has in all re- spects failed to comply with the said order of this court.
This affidavit is made in support of the motion of the respondent for forefeiture of the bail bond of said petiti- oner.
SUBSCRIBED and sworn to before me this 28th day of July, A. D. 1922.
Notary Public in and fore the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
Due and timely service of the within motion is hereby acknowledged this 28th day of July, 1922.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
